intro: Maytenus mossambicensis, commonly known as the African mayten, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions and full sun. Maytenus mossambicensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
